In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the function you want in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[\s-]" => "_")
end
```
This function `clean_column` works by first lowercasing the input string using the `lowercase` function, then stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces using the `strip` function. Then it replaces all spaces and hyphens in this cleaned string with underscores using the `replace` function with a regular expression (`r"[\s-]"`). 

You can test the function by calling it with a sample column name:
```julia
print(clean_column(" My Column ")) # prints "my_column"
```
